title.narrative: 4.2. DATA & EVIDENCE FOR PUBLIC POLICY

description.narrative: By 2021, the capacity of the State will be strengthen to increase the availability of disaggregated data and other evidence for monitoring the situation of adolescents and children and to inform policy., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, adolescents and children will continue to be recognized by society and the Peruvian State as subjects of law and will be prioritized in social regulations, policies and budgets.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the capacity of the State will be strengthen to increase the availability of disaggregated data and other evidence formonitoring the situation of adolescents and children and to inform policy.

description.narrative: UNICEF developed 11 pieces of research used to advocate with government to improve public services for children and adolescents, prioritize national spending on child protection and improve the response to integrate Venezuelan migrant population. UNICEF generated evidence on the impact of COVID-19 pandemic on mental health, leading to develop a pilot programme for adolescents. UNICEF contributed to knowledge management generation oneducation, health,and Peru’s experience in implementing social protection measures in the context of COVID -19. The country office has finalized a Situation Analysis, Gender Programmatic Review and Country Programme Evaluation which will be key in developing the new CPD. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: Number of studies promoted by UNICEF that provide information on effective interventions to improve the situation of the most excluded children and adolescents.(48296)
Reports or studies that include disaggregated data on children and adolescents, with emphasis on the most excluded, in priority areas.(48289)
Number of reports and studies generated by the State or the Academy, with the participation of UNICEF, on the public budget destined to childhood and adolescence(48290)

Number of reports and studies generated by the State or the Academy, with the participation of UNICEF, on the situation of children and adolescents and on the performance of public policies aimed at them.(48293)
